basic.floral_language:
Alcea rosea 
Floriography: tenacious, gentle, beautiful
Hollyhock has erect stems and large flowers of many colors, single-petal or multi-petal with a long flowering period, leaves green, similar to ivy leaves, with split leaf edges. Widely used for flower beds and home decoration, very popular.
Hollyhock likes sunshine, with half shade tolerance. Blooms from June to August for 2-3 weeks.
basic.blooming: Flowering period June-August, viewing period 2-3 weeks

maintenance.soil: Peat or soil with specific nutrients
maintenance.sunlight: Likes moderate sunlight, resistant to half shade
maintenance.watering: Water thoroughly after soil surface dries
maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions,  apply 1-2 times monthly in spring
maintenance.pruning: Remove old, diseased, dead leaves and withered flowers timely
